alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 22 at 3:09PM MDT until April 22 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Los Alamos County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Northern Santa Fe County in north central New Mexico... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 308 PM MDT, an area of dust stretched from Zia Pueblo to White Rock and Santa Fe, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery and surface observations. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 250 and 302. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 282 and 290. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 11 and 28. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Los Alamos, Espanola, White Rock, Pojoaque, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, San Ysidro, Santa Clara Pueblo and Cerrillos Hills State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust creates reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Santa Fe
